      • evaluate

        public static void evaluate​(org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model goldStd,
                            org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model test,
                            org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model answerModel,
                            String out,
                            boolean pertainFormat)
                     throws FileNotFoundException
        Evaluates the answerModel against the Gold standard and print the true positives, false positives, false negatives, F1-Measure, Recall and Precision into an TSV file. Further on evaluates the Macro and Micro F1-Measure and prints that to the TSV file to.

        Removes all resources in the test benchmark from the gold standard and answer model, to assure that the evaluation only uses new found solutions.

        Answer Model can be in two formats. Either the pertains format or the includes format

        Pertains Format 
         \@prefix lpres:<https://lpbenchgen.org/resource/>
 \@prefix lpprop:<ttps://lpbenchgen.org/property/>

 lpres:result_1 lpprop:pertainsTo lpres:lp_1;
     lpprop:resource test:Individual2;
     lpprop:resource test:Individual1;
     lpprop:belongsToLP true.

 lpres:result_2 lpprop:pertainsTo lpres:lp_1;
     lpprop:resource test:Individual9;
     lpprop:belongsToLP true.
        Includes Format 
         \@prefix lpres:<https://lpbenchgen.org/resource/>
 \@prefix lpprop:<https://lpbenchgen.org/property/>

 lpres:lp_1 lpprop:includesResource test:Individual1, test:Individual9, test:Individual2 .
        Parameters:
        goldStd - the gold standard
        test - the test benchmark model
        answerModel - the system answers
        out - the output tsv file
        pertainFormat - if is in Pertain Format or Includes Format
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - can be ignored.

      • evaluate

        protected static double[] evaluate​(List<String> gold,
                                   List<String> answers)
        Evaluates two lists of string.

        The first one is the gold standard, this list should contain all true answers. The second list contains the system answers.

        It will determine the true positives, false positives and false negatives in the answer list and calculates the F1-measure, the Recall and the Precision
        Parameters:
        gold - the Gold Standard
        answers - the system answers
        Returns:
        an array of doubles [tp,fp,fn,f1,recall,precision]

      • f1measure

        protected static double[] f1measure​(int tp,
                                    int fp,
                                    int fn)
        Calculates the F1-Measure, Recall and Precision from the true positives, false positives and false negatives
        Parameters:
        tp - true positives
        fp - false positives
        fn - false negatives
        Returns:
        A double array [f1,recall,precision]
